skill.name: ux-researcher-designer
skill.description: UX research and design toolkit for Senior UX Designer/Researcher including data-driven persona generation, journey mapping, usability testing frameworks, and research synthesis. Use for user research, persona creation, journey mapping, and design validation.

skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure Python utility script for persona generation. No network calls, no file system access beyond script execution, no external commands, no environment variable access. All behavior matches stated purpose.

content.user_title: Generate user personas from research data
content.value_statement: Creating user personas from raw research data is time-consuming and often inconsistent. This toolkit analyzes user behavior patterns, demographics, and interview insights to automatically generate research-backed personas with confidence scoring and design implications.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes user behavior patterns from raw data to identify trends
Generates four persona archetypes: power user, casual user, business user, mobile-first
Extracts psychographics including motivations, values, and attitudes
Creates usage scenarios based on persona type and patterns
Calculates confidence scores based on sample size
Derives actionable design implications from persona data
limitations: Requires structured user data input (age, usage frequency, device, pain points)
Does not conduct actual user interviews or surveys
Cannot validate personas against real user feedback without additional tools
Limited to four predefined archetype templates

use_cases.title: Synthesize interview data
use_cases.description: Convert raw user interview notes and survey responses into structured personas for stakeholder presentations.

use_cases.title: Inform design decisions
use_cases.description: Generate personas with design implications to guide feature prioritization and user flow decisions.

use_cases.title: Validate user segments
use_cases.description: Analyze user data to confirm or challenge assumptions about target user segments and their needs.

prompt_templates.title: Basic persona request
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the UX Researcher & Designer toolkit to generate a persona from this user data: [paste user research data with age, usage patterns, pain points, and device preferences]

prompt_templates.title: Persona with interviews
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a detailed persona from this user data, including interview insights about goals and motivations: [user data + interview quotes and observations]

prompt_templates.title: Compare user segments
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the attached user research dataset and generate personas for the different user segments you identify, including confidence levels and design implications for each.

prompt_templates.title: Mobile user focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the UX Researcher toolkit to create a mobile-first persona based on mobile usage data and on-the-go context patterns from the research findings provided.

output_examples.input: Generate a persona from this user data: 25 users, daily usage, primarily mobile, work context, pain points include slow loading and confusing navigation
output: A daily user who primarily uses the product for work purposes
Quote: "I need tools that can keep up with my workflow"
Demographics: Age 25-34, Urban, Tech Proficiency: Advanced
Goals: Complete tasks efficiently, Maximize productivity
Frustrations: Slow loading times, Confusing navigation, Lack of mobile optimization
Design Implications: Optimize for speed, Provide keyboard shortcuts, Mobile-first responsive design
Data: Based on 25 users, Confidence: Medium

best_practices: Provide at least 20 user data points for reliable persona generation and meaningful patterns
Include interview insights with quotes and motivations for richer psychographic detail
Validate generated personas with actual users before using them for design decisions
Use multiple personas to represent distinct user segments rather than one generic persona
anti_patterns: Using personas based on fewer than 10 users or assumptions rather than research data
Treating personas as exact representations instead of useful abstractions
Creating only one persona when user research reveals multiple distinct user segments
Ignoring the confidence score and treating low-sample personas as definitive

faq.question: What data format does the persona generator accept?
faq.answer: JSON array of user objects with fields like age, usage_frequency, primary_device, usage_context, features_used, pain_points, and tech_proficiency.

faq.question: How many users do I need for accurate personas?
faq.answer: The tool works with any sample size, but confidence is rated High for 50+ users, Medium for 20-50, and Low for fewer than 20.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing research tools?
faq.answer: The Python script reads from stdin or file input, making it compatible with data exports from surveys, analytics tools, and CRM systems.

faq.question: Is user data stored or sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The persona generator runs entirely locally in your environment and does not make any network calls or external connections.

faq.question: How is this different from manual persona creation?
faq.answer: The tool uses algorithmic pattern detection to identify trends across users, ensuring consistency and reducing bias compared to manual interpretation.

faq.question: What AI tools is this compatible with?
faq.answer: This toolkit works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It can be used standalone or invoked by AI assistants during research and design workflows.
